Title: Intracortical connectivity of architectonic fields in the somatic sensory, motor and parietal cortex of monkeys
Comments: Fig. 6 was not evaluated as it is not clearly stated by the text nor the figures whether the injection affected only area 1 or also area 2.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: p. 300: "The delineation is, thus, closer to that of Vogt and Vogt (1919) than that of other workers..."

p. 300: "The delineation is, thus, closer to that of Vogt and Vogt (1919) than that of other workers..."

p. 300: "In comparison with the most recent study of the architecture of this region (Powell and Mountcastle, 1959)...the major difference is in the position of the border between areas 2 and 5. This is placed a few mm's more posteriorly so that, medially, area 2 extends a little further into the posterior bank of the postcentral sulcus (Fig. 32) and laterally it occupies a somewhat greater portion of the inferior parietal lobule and of the banks of the intraparietal sulcus..."

p. 300: "This change in architecture serves as the basis for the recognition by Vogt and Vogt (1919) of an anteriorly placed area 5a and a posteriorly placed area 5b...The delineation is, thus, closer to that of Vogt and Vogt (1919) than that of other workers..."

p. 300: "This change in architecture serves as the basis for the recognition by Vogt and Vogt (1919) of an anteriorly placed area 5a and a posteriorly placed area 5b...The delineation is, thus, closer to that of Vogt and Vogt (1919) than that of other workers..."

p. 312: "Though cytoarchitectionally [the supplementary motor area] is indistinguishable from parts of area 6 lying on the exposed and lateral surfaces of the hemisphere, it appears to form a separate entity. This is mainly because the terminal labelling ensuing from injections...in any part of areas 1, 2, 3a, or 4...remains restricted to the vicinity of the cingulate sulcus and to the part of the gyrus lying dorsal to it."
@InterMapRelations.Comments: The term SMA is used by JCH78 without reference to any parcellation scheme;in  the figures, the SMA is constantly labelled by "area 6".

@Injections.Citation: "In the case of the most posteriorly situated injections of area 5, made near the medial border of the hemisphere (Fig. 13)..."
"Injections of isotope at the border of areas 3a and 4..." (Fig. 14)
"Injections restricted to area 4 on the exposed surface of the precentral gyrus in the forelimb representation...(Figs. 15, 16)."
"...an injection at the posterior margin of area 3b encroached upon the innediately adjacent part of area 1(Fig. 5)..."

"Injections of horseradish peroxidase in posterior parts of area 5 (Figs. 17, 44)..." (p. 309) "Injections of horseradish perocidase spanning most of the antero-posterior extent of area 5 and causing retrograde labeling in the anterior part of area 5 lateral to the supplementary motor area as well as in areas 3a and 4." (Figs. 17C, D)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Injections of horseradish peroxidase in posterior parts of area 5 (Figs. 15, 44)...retrogradely label corticocortical cells in layer III of areas 4 and 6." (p. 309) "Injections of horseradish perocidase spanning most of the antero-posterior extent of area 5 and causing retrograde labeling in the anterior part of area 5 lateral to the supplementary motor area as well as in areas 3a and 4." (Figs. 17C, D)

"Injections of horseradish peroxidase more anteriorly placed in area 4 in the forelimb region..." (Fig. 9)

publication.title: Intracortical connectivity of architectonic fields in the somatic sensory, motor and parietal cortex of monkeys
